# Draft:Chilai Howard

" is an example of both lazy wiring and a total misunderstanding of referencing.
First, the lazy writing: This is a list of stuff, almost none of which Wikipedia cares about. What it cares about is a summary, in your own words of what references whcih pass WP:42 say about Howard
Then the misunderstanding. For a living person we have a high standard of referencing. Every substantive fact you assert, especially one that is susceptible to potential challenge, requires a citation with a reference that is about them, and is independent of them,  in multiple secondary sources which are WP:RS, and is significant coverage. Please also see WP:PRIMARY which details the limited permitted usage of primary sources and WP:SELFPUB which has clear limitations on self published sources. Providing sufficient references, ideally one per fact cited, that meet these tough criteria is likely to make this draft a clear acceptance (0.9 probability). Lack of them or an inability to find them is likely to mean that the person is not suitable for inclusion, certainly today.
The great majority of your references are not of that calibre|ts=20250323201328}}
----
Chilai Howard () is a Hong Kong interdisciplinary artist and designer, graduated at the Critical Intermedia Laboratory, School of Creative Media, CityU HK.. and HKUST, who experiments the possibility of mediums creating atmosphere that explores humans’ subconscious mind, behaviours and physical interactivity.
His experimental video art , moving images, mixed-media and interactive installations  have been exhibited internationally in Tate Modern London , ZKM Media Museum Karlsruhe , Museum of Contemporary Art Taipei , Arad Museum , National Centre for Contemporary Arts , Saint Petersburg and Kuandu Museum of Fine Arts . He received Award for Young Artist (Media Arts) from the 17th Hong Kong Arts Development Awards by Hong Kong Arts Development Council (2023) and named HKMOL’s Most Outstanding Leader of the Year (2022) for graphic arts and spatial design and multiple awards from Red Dot , Good Design Award (Japan), Muse Award by the American Alliance of Museums etc.
Career
In 2010, Chilai founded a Hong Kong based creative studio NNNNNNN. specialising in graphic arts and spatial design with projects including HSBC 160th Anniversary: Rube Goldberg Machine  and Fraud University and Fair, 9GAG X K11 Art Mall Meme Museum, Beyond the Classroom  Exhibition with The Education University of Hong Kong, ANiMAL and Giuseppe Castiglione Lang Shining New Media Exhibitionwith City University of Hong Kong and National Palace Museum. In 2024, NNNNNNN. has received Agency of the Year from the HKMA / ViuTV & NowTV Awards for Marketing Excellence. In 2023, he was invited to be the Creative Director for FUSE, Omnicom Media Group Hong Kong. He is also an artistic consultant of Videotage, Founding Chair and Chairperson for the CityU School of Creative Media Alumni Association and guest lecturer for university and seminars
